common.usage: To use the {{component}} component, simply import it into your React file:

propertiesDescription.activeIcon: Icon to display when the accordion item is active.
propertiesDescription.canSelfCollapse: Allows the active item to collapse when clicked again.
propertiesDescription.children: The accordion items to display. Each child must provide a title and content.
propertiesDescription.className: Additional CSS classes to apply to the accordion wrapper.
propertiesDescription.defaultActiveIndex: The initially active accordion item index.
propertiesDescription.direction: Defines the orientation of the accordion, either vertical or horizontal.
propertiesDescription.inactiveIcon: Icon to display when the accordion item is inactive.

accordion.subtitle: The accordion component is a collapsible content display element that allows users to expand or collapse sections with optional icons, orientations, and self-collapse behavior.
accordion.title: Accordion

button.title: Button
button.subtitle: The Button component is a flexible and customizable button implementation for React applications. It supports various properties for styling, behavior, and functionality, making it suitable for different use cases.

checkboxInput.title: CheckboxInput
checkboxInput.subtitle: The CheckboxInput component is a versatile and reusable component that supports both single and multiple checkbox selections. It allows for customization through a variety of props and handles validation, error messages, and helper texts.

usage.customLabel: Custom label for single checkbox input
usage.customOptionsLabel: Custom label for multiple checkbox input
usage.customOptionsLabelDescription: The `renderOptionsLabel` function in a checkbox group allows custom rendering of options label. You can use it to display rich content like icons, descriptions, or formatted text.

confirmationModal.title: Confirmation modal
confirmationModal.message: Are you sure you want to proceed?

propertiesDescription.code: The ISO country code to display (e.g., 'US', 'gb').
propertiesDescription.className: CSS class to append to the wrapper span.
propertiesDescription.fallbackLocale: Locale to use if the specific translation is missing.
propertiesDescription.i18n: External translation dictionary for additional languages.

propertiesDescription.data: Custom country data to overwrite existing entries or add new ones.
propertiesDescription.exclude: An array of country codes to remove from the list.
propertiesDescription.fallbackLocale: Locale used when active locale translation is missing.
propertiesDescription.favorites: An array of country codes to prioritize and display at the top of the list.
propertiesDescription.flags: If true, displays country flags alongside country names
propertiesDescription.flagsPath: A function that returns the URL/path of the flag image for a given country code
propertiesDescription.flagsPosition: Position of the flags relative to the country name
propertiesDescription.flagsStyle: Shape of the flags to be displayed
propertiesDescription.groups: An object to organize countries into specific categories (e.g., EU, ASEAN).
propertiesDescription.i18n: Additional translation catalogues to be supported.
propertiesDescription.include: An array of country codes (e.g., ['US', 'DE']). Only these countries will be visible.
propertiesDescription.includeFavorites: If false, removes favorite items from the main list.
propertiesDescription.label: The label text displayed above the picker.
propertiesDescription.locale: The locale code (e.g., 'en', 'fr'). Accepts custom codes (like 'np') if provided in data.
propertiesDescription.multiple: If true, allows selecting multiple countries.
propertiesDescription.name: The name attribute for the input field.
propertiesDescription.onChange: Callback function triggered when the selection changes.
propertiesDescription.placeholder: Placeholder text displayed when no selection is made.
propertiesDescription.value: The currently selected country code (or array of codes if multiple).

data.title: Data
data.subtitle: The Data component is a reusable React component designed to display a labeled value.

dropdownMenu.subtitle: The Dropdown component provides an accessible and customizable menu for selecting actions or options. It supports labels, icons, slots for custom triggers and icons, and emits events on selection.
dropdownMenu.title: Dropdown menu

usage.hiddenDropdownIcon: Hidden dropdown icon with default label

basic.title: Basic
basic.description: Editable title can be used by passing a `title` property. Title level is optional, it is `h1` by default. `onblur` event on the title input field triggers `onUpdate` method.

controlled.title: Controlled
controlled.description: Editable title can be used as a controllable element by passing `onChange` property. Note this will impact the performance of the component.

disabled.description: The edit function can be disabled. To do this, pass the `allowEdit` option with value `false`.
disabled.title: Disabled edit

customToggler.description: The toggle button can be customized by pass your own toggler using `toggler` prop.
customToggler.title: Custom toggler

editableTitle.subtitle: Editable title is an extension to a page or section title which can be edited.
editableTitle.title: Editable title

message.deleteUser: You are going to delete the user {{user}}.
message.deleteUserData: You are going to delete the user {{user}} data.

messages.addHorizontal: Add following css to your stylesheet for horizontal borders
messages.addVertical: Add following css to your stylesheet for vertical borders

propertiesDescription.columnActionButtonLabel: Label for the action button in toolbar section for sorting and visibility toggle
propertiesDescription.customFormatters: Collection of custom formatting functions for cell values
propertiesDescription.dataActionMenu: List of actions properties available for each row
propertiesDescription.emptyTableMessage: Message shown when the table has no data
propertiesDescription.enableSortingRemoval: Allows a column’s sort state to toggle between ascending, descending, and none
propertiesDescription.fetchData: Function to fetch server-side data with pagination, sorting, and filtering
propertiesDescription.handleResetState: Function called when reset button is clicked
propertiesDescription.highlightHeader: Highlights the currently active column header
propertiesDescription.id: Unique identifier required for persisting table state
propertiesDescription.inputDebounceTime: Debounce time for column filter inputs
propertiesDescription.isLoading: Displays a loading overlay on the table
propertiesDescription.onRowSelectChange: Callback function when row selection changes
propertiesDescription.persistState: Persists table state across page reloads
propertiesDescription.persistStateStorage: Storage type used for persisting table state
propertiesDescription.renderCustomPagination: Function to render a custom pagination component
propertiesDescription.renderSortIcons: Function to render custom sort icons in column headers
propertiesDescription.renderTableFooterContent: Function to render custom content in the table footer
propertiesDescription.renderToolbarItems: Function to render custom items in the toolbar
propertiesDescription.rowClassName: Addtional CSS class for row styling
propertiesDescription.rowPerPage: Default number of rows per page
propertiesDescription.rowPerPageOptions: Available options for rows per page
propertiesDescription.showColumnAction: Shows a button for column sorting and visibility controls in toolbar section
propertiesDescription.showResetButton: Shows reset button in the toolbar section
propertiesDescription.titleInfo: Configuration for table title’s text and alignment
propertiesDescription.totalRecords: Total number of records for table
propertiesDescription.visibleColumns: Controls column’s visibility and order initially

table.subtitle: The table component is a flexible and powerful solution for managing and displaying tabular data.
table.title: Table

usage.builtInActionColumn: Table demonstrating built in actions column use case
usage.customCellDataFormatting: Table with custom cell data formatter
usage.withCustomFilter: Table with custom filter component and filterFn
usage.customStaticFilter: Table with custom  filter component and static filterFn
usage.rowSpecificActions: Table with actions menu items filtered based on row data logic
usage.tableBorderHorizontal: Table with custom style for horizontal border
usage.tableBorderVertical: Table with custom style for vertical border

message.subtitle: The Message component displays contextual messages with optional icons and a closable action. It supports custom slots, making it flexible for various use cases.

propertiesDescription.enableClose: Displays a close icon if true, allowing the message to be dismissed.
propertiesDescription.icon: Icon to display alongside the message.
propertiesDescription.message: The message text to display in the component.
propertiesDescription.onClose: Function to be called when the message is closed.
propertiesDescription.severity: Defines the styling severity of the message. Defaults to 'info'.
propertiesDescription.showIcon: Show default icon based on severity or custom icon if provided.

message.title: Message

modal.title: Modal

propertiesDescription.className: Additional CSS classes to apply to the modal.
propertiesDescription.onHide: Emitted when the modal is requested to close.
propertiesDescription.size: Defines the width of the modal.
propertiesDescription.visible: Controls the visibility of the modal.

modal.subtitle: A modal dialog component for displaying content in an overlay with support for custom headers, footers, and dismissal logic.

disableTabState.subTitle: By default, tab state is persisted between page refresh and navigations. You can disable this feature by passing persistState={false} prop to the component
disableTabState.title: State persistence disabled

disableTabState.subTitle: By default, tab state is persisted between page refresh and navigations. You can disable this feature by passing persistState={false} prop to the component
disableTabState.title: State persistence disabled

select.autoSortOptionsInfo: By default, options are sorted alphabetically. To render options in original order as provided, you can use autoSortOptions={false}
select.label: Country

propertiesDescription.autoSortOptions: By default, options are sorted alphabetically by label. If set to false, the order of options is preserved.
propertiesDescription.autoSelectSingleOption: If true, in case of single option it automatically gets selected.
propertiesDescription.disableGroupSelect: Remove checkbox on group label for selecting all group options.
propertiesDescription.disableSearch: Disables the search functionality inside the select component.
propertiesDescription.errorMessage: Displays an error message below the component.
propertiesDescription.enableTooltip: When enableTooltip is true, select component renders the <Tooltip> component for the selected value.
propertiesDescription.helperText: Displays a helper text below the component.
propertiesDescription.hideIfSingleOption: If there is only one option, and multiple is false, the Select component will not render the dropdown at all when set to true.
propertiesDescription.label: Label of the component.
propertiesDescription.labelKey: The key in option object to use as the display label.
propertiesDescription.multiple: If true, multiple selection is enabled.
propertiesDescription.name: Name of the component.
propertiesDescription.options: Options to pass in the select component.
propertiesDescription.showRemoveSelection: If true, icon to remove selected options is visible.
propertiesDescription.tooltipOptions: Options to customize the tooltip’s behavior(example: position, offset).
propertiesDescription.valueKey: The key in option object to use as value.
propertiesDescription.renderOption: Function to be called to render custom select options.
propertiesDescription.renderValue: Function to be called to render custom select value.
propertiesDescription.onChange: Function to be called when value changes.

select.title: Select

switchInput.title: Switch input
switchInput.subtitle: The SwitchInput component is a customizable checkbox switch for toggling states. It supports additional properties such as error handling and labeling.
